Package nl.uu.cs.aplib.exampleUsages.fiveGame

Class Strategies

java.lang.Object
nl.uu.cs.aplib.exampleUsages.fiveGame.Strategies
public class Strategies extends Object
Strategies for playing FiveGame. They are programmed in Prolog and will be used by our aplib-agent later in FiveGame_withAgent.
Author:
wish

    Modifier and Type
    Field
    Description
    (package private) static String
    blocked
     
    (package private) static PrologReasoner.PredicateName
    blockMove
    blockMove(X,Y) : the opponent has a free triple-circles, and that placing a cross in (X,Y) would block one side of this triple.
    (package private) static String
    circle

    eastNeighbor
    eastNeighbor(Ty,X1,X2,Y) : (X2,Y) is occupied by a piece of type Ty, and X1=X2-1.

    northEastNeighbor
    northEastNeighbor(Ty,X1,Y1,X2,Y2) : (X2,Y2) is occupied by a piece of type Ty, and X1=X2-1 and Y1=Y2-1.

    northNeighbor
    northNeighbor(Ty,X,Y1,Y2) : (X,Y2) is occupied by a piece of type Ty, and Y1=Y2-1.
    (package private) static PrologReasoner.PredicateName

    occupied(Ty,X,Y): square (X,Y) is occupied by a piece of type Ty (which can be a blocker).

    set4Move
    set4Move(X,Y) : cross-player has a triple, and placing a cross at (X,Y) would extend this triple to a quadruple (one away from winning).

    southEastNeighbor
    southEastNeighbor(Ty,X1,Y1,X2,Y2) : (X2,Y2) is occupied by a piece of type Ty, and X1=X2-1 and Y1=Y2+1.

  • Field Details

    • cross

      static String cross

    • circle

      static String circle

    • blocked

      static String blocked

    • winningMove

      static PrologReasoner.PredicateName winningMove
      winningMove(X,Y) : (X,Y) would be a winning move for cross. Currently the strategies below do not include diagonal winning move.

    • occupied

      static PrologReasoner.PredicateName occupied
      occupied(Ty,X,Y): square (X,Y) is occupied by a piece of type Ty (which can be a blocker).

    • free

      static PrologReasoner.PredicateName free

    • eastNeighbor

      static PrologReasoner.PredicateName eastNeighbor
      eastNeighbor(Ty,X1,X2,Y) : (X2,Y) is occupied by a piece of type Ty, and X1=X2-1.

    • northNeighbor

      static PrologReasoner.PredicateName northNeighbor
      northNeighbor(Ty,X,Y1,Y2) : (X,Y2) is occupied by a piece of type Ty, and Y1=Y2-1.

    • northEastNeighbor

      static PrologReasoner.PredicateName northEastNeighbor
      northEastNeighbor(Ty,X1,Y1,X2,Y2) : (X2,Y2) is occupied by a piece of type Ty, and X1=X2-1 and Y1=Y2-1.

    • southEastNeighbor

      static PrologReasoner.PredicateName southEastNeighbor
      southEastNeighbor(Ty,X1,Y1,X2,Y2) : (X2,Y2) is occupied by a piece of type Ty, and X1=X2-1 and Y1=Y2+1.

    • blockMove

      static PrologReasoner.PredicateName blockMove
      blockMove(X,Y) : the opponent has a free triple-circles, and that placing a cross in (X,Y) would block one side of this triple.

    • set4Move

      static PrologReasoner.PredicateName set4Move
      set4Move(X,Y) : cross-player has a triple, and placing a cross at (X,Y) would extend this triple to a quadruple (one away from winning). Currently the strategies below do not include diagonal quadruples.

    • tripleWestEast

      static PrologReasoner.PredicateName tripleWestEast
